page.title: 11The Church
page.content: The church is 169 years old although there was a church over at Clachan thought to be built before 1690. Hundreds of visitors from all over the world come to see our church because it is octagonal and there is only a handful of churches of that shape. There is an old saying that if you have an octagonal church the Devil can't hide in the corners. There are three churches that the minister works in and they are Carrick Castle, Lochgoilhead and Cairndow covering a distance of about thirty miles. The main church is in Lochgoilhead and the minister lives there. Only about ten people attend the church on a Sunday but if the minister lived in Cairndow perhaps more people might come.
